author: jimmygchen
content:
Hi, is Kurtosis `mock` mev mode deneb-ready? (I vaguely remember it was mentioned on an earlier CL/dencun testing call) 
I've started it with `mev_type` set to `mock` but not seeing any mock server being spun up, so wondering if I'm doing anything wrong.

author: barnabasbusa
content: looks like quite some pairs have gone out of sync on devnet 8

author: marekm3498
content: just FYI for others, teku-nethermind is expected (we're testing something)

author: tersec
content:
Erigon returns `INVALID` on `newPayload` for the same block `0x321dea00c4853ee354bebaf8aef3e63fbe06c4508271c0db4c92b0f087aedc3b` for which Geth and Nethermind return `VALID`. At that point, Nimbus gets confused, because it can't build on the same block as the rest.

According to https://dencun-devnet-8.beaconcha.in/block/171035 this block is valid

author: tersec
content: The other Nimbus-EL pairs all look healthy

author: yperbasis
content: The cause of that was "mdbx_cursor_open: cannot allocate memory" in erigon on that block. Could the machine be running out of RAM?

author: tersec
content: random error should _never_ trigger `INVALID`

author: tersec
content: that's wrong and bad

author: tersec
content: `SYNCING`/`ACCEPTED` are okay

author: tersec
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/sync/optimistic.md#transitioning-from-valid---invalidated-or-invalidated---valid
> These operations are purposefully omitted. It is outside of the scope of the specification since it's only possible with a faulty EE.
> 
> Such a scenario requires manual intervention.

content: no other erigon nodes were close to running out of ram

author: yperbasis
content: Right, we need to improve that bit of error handling logic in erigon

author: barnabasbusa
content: but yeah agree with Tersec here, we shouldn't have invalid block from OOM even

content: definitely! this bricks us badly
